meanings.definition: The remaining part of something that has been broken or worn away
meanings.sent1: He found a stub of a pencil on the floor.
meanings.sent2: She tore off the stub of the receipt and threw it away.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the stub of a branch as a makeshift umbrella.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stump stood like a proud stub of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The stub of the candle flickered in the dark room.

meanings.definition: A small piece of paper, metal, etc., that is attached to a larger object and that has information written on it
meanings.sent1: He handed the ticket stub to the attendant.
meanings.sent2: She kept the movie stub as a souvenir.
meanings.sent3: The stub of the boarding pass fluttered in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The stub of the raffle ticket held the winning number.
meanings.sent5: The concert stub was a reminder of a fun night out.

meanings.definition: To accidentally hit your toe against something hard
meanings.sent1: Ouch! I stubbed my toe on the table leg.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to stub your toe on the door frame.
meanings.sent3: He stubbed his toe and hopped around in pain.
meanings.sent4: She stubbed her toe and let out a yelp.
meanings.sent5: Stubbing your toe is never a pleasant experience.
